terms.definition: A system that stores all organizational documents in a single, unified platform, making them easily accessible and manageable from one location.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions when needed.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, providing transparency and accountability for compliance purposes.
Pre-configured sequences of tasks and processes that execute automatically based on triggers or schedules, reducing manual intervention and ensuring consistency.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet through a subscription.
The ability to generate and display data reports instantly as information is updated, providing current insights without delays.
The systematic analysis of data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform decision-making and strategy.
Software features that enable multiple users to work together on documents and projects, including sharing, commenting, and simultaneous editing capabilities.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A comprehensive software environment that provides the foundation and tools for building, deploying, and managing applications and services.
The ability to track and document the history, location, and changes of information or processes throughout their lifecycle.
A centralized storage system designed specifically for organizing, storing, and retrieving digital documents and files.
Structured sequences of tasks and approvals designed to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements and organizational policies.
The process of examining datasets to draw conclusions and insights, often using specialized software tools and statistical methods.
System-generated notifications that alert users about upcoming deadlines, required actions, or scheduled tasks without manual intervention.
